description: A delicious and nutritious curry made with tomatoes, peanuts, coconut milk, and hearty vegetables.
ingredients: [{"name": "curry powder", "units": "teaspoons", "amount": 2.25}, {"name": "cumin powder", "units": "teaspoons", "amount": 1.25}, {"name": "salt", "units": "teaspoon", "amount": 1}, {"name": "cinnamon powder", "units": "teaspoon", "amount": 0.5}, {"name": "smoked paprika powder", "units": "teaspoon", "amount": 0.5}, {"name": "coriander powder", "units": "teaspoon", "amount": 0.5}, {"name": "turmeric powder", "units": "teaspoon", "amount": 0.25}, {"name": "cardamom powder", "units": "teaspoon", "amount": 0.25}, {"name": "black pepper", "units": "teaspoon", "amount": 0.25}, {"name": "clove powder", "units": "teaspoon", "amount": 0.125}, {"name": "cayenne powder", "units": "teaspoon", "amount": 0.125}, {"name": "zucchini", "units": "cups", "amount": 2}, {"name": "sweet potato", "units": "cups", "amount": 1.5}, {"name": "red bell pepper", "units": "cup", "amount": 1}, {"name": "yellow onion", "units": "cup", "amount": 1}, {"name": "carrot", "units": "cup", "amount": 0.5}, {"name": "garlic", "units": "tablespoon", "amount": 1}, {"name": "fresh ginger", "units": "teaspoon", "amount": 1}, {"name": "water", "units": "cup", "amount": 1}, {"name": "canned garbanzo beans", "units": "cups", "amount": 1.5}, {"name": "coconut milk", "units": "cups", "amount": 1.5}, {"name": "canned diced tomatoes", "units": "cups", "amount": 1.5}, {"name": "peanut butter", "units": "cup", "amount": 0.25}, {"name": "lacinato kale", "units": "cups", "amount": 2}]
instructions: 1. Stir all of the spices together in a small bowl and set aside for now. 2. Heat a stockpot or Dutch oven over medium heat for 2 minutes. Add the zucchini, sweet potatoes, bell peppers, onions, carrots, garlic, and ginger. Cook for 5 minutes, stirring occasionally and adding a small splash of water if things begin to stick. 3. Add the spice mixture you set aside earlier and cook for 1 minute, stirring constantly, until the spices smell heavenly. Add the water and stir up the stuck bits from the bottom of the pot. 4. Add the garbanzo beans, coconut milk, tomatoes (including the juice), and peanut butter and stir until the peanut butter dissolves. Bring just to a boil, then lower heat to a simmer. Place a lid on the pot at an angle and simmer for 20 minutes, stirring occasionally and making sure to stir the bottom of the pot to keep things from sticking. 5. Remove the lid, add the kale, and simmer an additional 5-10 minutes, without a lid, until the veggies are tender. 6. Dish out and serve alone or over the cooked grain of your choice.
notes: This recipe makes about 8 cups of Kilimanjaro Coconut Curry, enough for 3–4 servings if eaten on its own—more when served over cooked brown rice or another grain.
